intro: Vanda lamellata var. lamellata, commonly known as the waxy vanda, is a terrestrial orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its fleshy, dark green leaves and produces striking, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its flowers bloom in clusters and can last for several weeks, making it a popular choice for botanical gardens and collectors. Vanda lamellata var. lamellata is also valued for its ornamental beauty and resilience in cultivation.
